question: Will another Hurricane Make Landfall in the Lower 48 States Before October 15?
description: This market shall resolve to "Yes" if a hurricane makes landfall in the conterminous United States between the launch of this market, September 16, 2021 at 3:00 PM ET, and 11:59:59 PM ET on October 14, 2021 as reported in official National Hurricane Center advisories. The status of the hurricane at landfall and the approximate time of landfall as reported in the advisory indicating landfall will be used to resolve this market. If no tropical systems make landfall as hurricane status between the launch of this market and October 14, this market shall resolve to "No." For the purposes of this market, a hurricane landfall is said to occur when a hurricane's surface center intersects with the coastline, as described at ttps://www.nhc.noaa.gov/aboutgloss.shtml#LANDFALL. No retrospective analyses after the advisory indicating landfall will have any bearing on the resolution of this market.

question: Will the United States average less than 75k Covid cases by November 15?
description:
This is a market on whether the United States will report a 7-day average of under 75,000 COVID-19 cases between September 15, 2021 and November 15, 2021 inclusive. This market will resolve on data from the CDC's Data Tracker, specifically, the 7-day moving average of COVID-19 cases for the United States, which is available at https://covid.cdc.gov/covid-data-tracker/#trends_dailytrendscases (navigate to "Select a state or territory" and select “United States”, and then scroll to "Data Table for Daily Case Trends" and view the data in the "7-Day Moving Avg" column, which is able to be sorted in descending order). 

The resolution source will be reviewed once daily at 8 PM ET, to see if the United States reported a 7-day COVID-19 case average between September 15 and November 15 inclusive of below 75,000. If an average below 75,000 is detected, it will be checked again 7 days later. If it is still under 75,000 at that point, the market will be resolved. If it is 75,000 or above, then the market will not resolve based on that data point. 

The final check will be on November 22, 2021, 8 PM ET, checking the 7-day average on all days from September 15, 2021 to November 15, 2021. If no average under 75,000 is detected at this point, the market will end and resolve "No."

question: Will more than 40.5 points be scored in Giants v. Washington?
description: This is a market on whether there will be more than 40.5 points scored in the NFL week 2 matchup between the Washington Football Team and the New York Giants, scheduled to take place on September 16, 2021, at 8:20 PM ET. This market will resolve to "Yes" if more than 40.5 points are scored in aggregate between the two teams, and "No" if less than 40.5 points are scored. If the match is postponed to a date on or before October 16, 2021, the same market conditions will apply. If the match is postponed to a date after October 16, 2021, or canceled altogether, the market will resolve 50-50. In the event of ambiguity in terms of the market outcome, the market will be resolved at the sole discretion of the Markets Integrity Committee (MIC).
